channel.title: Rune Knifes
channel.description: So I found out there are rune knifes on American Rune Pk. But it says they're disabled when i try to use them. Does anyone have a idea on how i fix it? I know i have to add projectiles, change attack styles, xp given etc. But i don't know how...[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 16, 2009, 04:29:26 am[/size][hr]Someone help plox?

item.title: Rune Knifes
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

you could still keep the hasknife boolean for if you wanted it later. also, this shoulodn’t give you errors i deleted them myself o.o if you still encounter 100 errors then you could just comment out (add // before the line, or start the lines with /* and end them with */ for multiple lines.)

/*sM("Knives are disabled for now!");
ResetAttack();
return false;
*/

that way the code wouldn’t do anything any you won’t have errors because you didn’t remove any brackets. but like pure demons said, check your client.java for any extra/missing brackets and you’ll probably find one.

Read full topic

item.title: Rune Knifes
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Demons Pure Demons
item.description:
@Pure_Demons wrote:

[quote=“Nullz, post:3, topic:256743”]tryed this… and i deleted exacly what you told me dint put extra spaces or dint delete anything more…
got over 100 errores.[/quote]

Did you accidently forget to take off an bracket? Or take off an extra? Or add one? A misplaced bracket is a common error.

Read full topic

item.title: Rune Knifes
item.dc:creator: @hellwsfull hellwsfull
item.description:
@hellwsfull wrote:

well thats very easy to make it stop saying disabled>.>
search this and delete them all 3

if(hasKnife()){
sM(“Knives are disabled for now!”);
ResetAttackNPC();
return false;
}
if(hasKnife()){
sM(“Knives are disabled for now!”);
ResetAttack();
return false;
}
public boolean hasKnife(){
int a = playerEquipment[playerWeapon];
if(a == 863 || a == 864 || a == 865 || a == 866 || a == 867 || a == 868 || a == 869){
return true;
}

they all in client.java

Read full topic
